text: Musical.ly was a mobile app available for phones where users could make short videos with music and slow motion. The videos would be sped up by the app to be at a normal speed. This allowed for lip syncing to be popular on the app. In November of 2017, Musical.ly was bought out by ByteDance. It is now known as TikTok. ==References== Category:2014 establishments in California Category:American social networking websites Category:Video sharing websites
title: Musical.ly
